STARTUP JOURNEY

 
 

As a part of my MSc Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Management course at Imperial College Business School, our group was qualified to take part in acting as a consultant group for one of PwC's experimental project, "Startup Journey". For my part, I had been working on the recommendation on how the platform could improve in terms of its experience by introducing some alternative UI concepts. Additionally, I have produced a couple of infographic examples and an explanatory video as an attempt to replace a big chunk of texts in order to improve the experience of the readers.

 
 
 

UI Concept Ideation

 
 

After learning about the platform and initial feedbacks from the team, including both PwC's and my sub-team, I have generated a couple of sketches to demonstrate where the platform's UI could be progressing towards. Although it was not particularly our job to redesign the UI directly, it was vital to raise awareness of the importance of the UI in improving the experience of the users, especially when the platform was poorly designed aesthetically. These wireframe sketches were employed in the early presentation sessions to pass on the design suggestions to the web design & developer team.

 
 

Additionally, we, the sub-team, was asked to each suggest how one academic content page can be improved. Here I was assigned with the "Knowing Your Market" page and I have chosen to produce another low-fidelity wireframe sketch with full annotations for the purpose of demonstrating a clearer and more structured web typography for content chunks. A mid-fidelity example of this page has also been created to compliment.

 
 
 

explanatory video production

 
 

Furthermore, our sub-team has suggested that many of the content chunks can be transformed into infographics, videos, and interactive modules. And with this suggesting, I have been asked to prototype an explanatory video for the "Introduction to Business Model Canvas" section. Here, I was responsible for storyboarding, character designing, and video production.

 
 

Once the story line for the video was approved by the team during a presentation, I then moved towards finalising the character concept and creating graphical assets to be used in the video production. The character, Lizzie, has been aesthetically modified several time to ensure that she meets the project's visual guideline.

 
 

Initially, the video animation was planned to be done on Adobe After Effect, but due to the time constraint and for the purpose of being able to modify at ease by the team, PowerPoint was used as the animator. Finally, the video was voiced by a member of the PwC team, Joe Iles, using the script written by our sub-team member, Indi Andamari.
